channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NYT Strands Hints, Spangram, Answers: Friday, February 6 (Let’s Face It)
item.description: Looking for some help with today's NYT Strands? An extra hint and the answers are right here to help you finish the grid and keep your streak intact.

item.title: I’m a 25-year-old founder who loves robots but too many humanoids are militant and creepy-looking. Things need to change—just look at Elon Musk
item.description: Who’s raising our robots? Teaching social norms in the age of humanoid robots.

item.title: As AI Eats Software, Many Big Enterprises Are Winning
item.description: While the fears about the impact of AI pummel software stocks, many leading industrial and biotech companies are seeing huge gains from AI.

item.title: Chrysler recalls more than 450,000 vehicles over brake light failure
item.description: Chrysler recalled more than 450,000 vehicles and more than 2,000 tow-trailer modules due to a brake light failure that could raise the risk of a crash...

item.title: The Uncomfortable Truth About FDEs
item.description: FDEs helps AI companies win enterprise deals fast, but they can also destroy margins and roadmaps. Here’s the real economics behind forward deployment...

item.title: OpenAI announces Frontier, an AI agent platform for enterprises to power apps like Salesforce and Workday—but could it eventually replace them?
item.description: OpenAI’s new enterprise platform lets companies build and manage agents that sit on top of existing software, blurring the line between partner and co...

item.title: There’s A Big Problem With Fortnite’s New Jinu And HUNTR/X Skins
item.description: Fortnite continues its KPop Demon Hunters collab today, but it still has a big problem that has yet to be fixed in this second go-round.

item.title: Options traders pile into tech hedges after software rout
item.description: “The question is how low do you go?” said Michael Bailey of FBB Capital Partners. “Investors hate software, that’s pretty clear.”

item.title: Michael Lewis reveals he’s got a deal to write the Sam Altman book—when ChatGPT is ready to write a rival draft
item.description: Altman admitted over dinner that ChatGPT wasn't nearly advanced enough, Lewis claimed. "He said, it'd be a really bad book."

item.title: NYT Connections Answers Explained (Friday, February 6, #971)
item.description: Not sure what today's NYT Connections answers are all about? Find out just what the different words in today's grid mean and how they fit together.

item.title: Trump is giving the U.S. economy a $65 billion tax-refund shot in the arm, mostly for higher-income people, BofA says
item.description: "The consumer divide is about to get deeper," BofA's senior U.S. economist Aditya Bhave wrote on Wednesday.

item.description: The figure reported on Wednesday is below economists’ estimates of an increase of 48,000 jobs and higher than the prior month’s revised reading of a g...

item.title: China moves to ban feature commonly seen on Tesla vehicles over fear of trapped passengers
item.description: China bans electronic door handles starting 2027, requiring mechanical releases after safety incidents left passengers trapped inside vehicles.

item.title: Fed's Miran maintains call for aggressive interest rate cuts this year
item.description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran is calling for aggressive interest rate cuts exceeding one percentage point after dissenting in the latest FOMC...

item.title: Energy giant bets big on US, says its electricity market 'hottest' in the world
item.description: Siemens Energy announced a $1 billion investment to expand U.S. grid equipment and turbine production, citing surging power demand driven by artificia...

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
